name: Melanie Daugherty
text: Josh O'Neal is the absolute worst attorney I have ever had. He refuses to return phone calls. He called me ONE TIME during my divorce, the day before the hearing. He never even bothered to send me the final divorce decree. I had no idea what my divorce papers said until his secretary emailed them to me, after the THIRD request. I know all of his secretaries because they are the only ones I could ever talk to. Half the time, they didn't return phone calls either. Halfway through the 'mediation' I got the distinct feeling that he was working for the other side. He obviously thinks he can make a living by gaining clients, screwing them over, and going on to the next victim. He must be too young and immature to grasp the concept that most people will need an attorney more than ONCE in their lifetime, and if he thinks he can be successful without the benefit of repeat clients, he is delusional. If he was the last attorney on earth, I would never hire him again. My divorce is final; I'm still missing half my belongings; he's promised me a refund twice and never delivered. On top of that, he suggested we file a contempt motion because of the fact that I was not given all the belongings I was entitled to. He didn't mention at the time that he planned on charging me an additional $1500 to do what I'd already paid him to do. In my opinion, the reason all his pictures on FB look like gangster photos is because he is a crook. He will stand there and 'listen' to you, but he is just pretending to hear you. You'd have more luck talking to a brick wall. Plus the brick wall might return your calls. I read a bad review of his, and I should have heeded it. If you need a great attorney, contact Michael Haynes.

text:
After our bad accident (a semi truck merged into us at 65mph) myself and my mother-in-law were referred to Heninger Garrison Davis as the people who could help us the best. Let me tell you, they were right. The people we worked closest with were Mark,  Eric, and Beverly, and they are all so friendly and helpful.

Even considering that I moved to a different timezone shortly after the accident, I still felt that I was able to easily communicate with them about any questions or concerns I was having (they respond with most efficiency to email in my experience).

During negotiations with the other party (which lets face it, thats the part all of us care about the most) I was shocked by how willing this practice was to work with us and help us obtain the settlement we needed to finally put this ugly event behind us. While I sincerly hope that I am never in another situation that would call for it, I would happily use this law firm again and/or refer them to any friend or family member in need of legal representation.

name: Tommy Vercetti
text:
This is what I call a back office lawyer.

Attorneys like this are only looking to send a letter possibly make a phone call and get you some compensation they don’t like seeing the inside of a court room they don’t like pursuing cases that are potentially difficult they are only looking for the quick money.

They take 30-60% of the settlement amount for simply writing a letter demanding compensation.

There is nothing wrong with taking a fee there is nothing wrong with sending a letter demanding compensation.

The problem lies in the fact that the attorney is not interested in pursuing your case far enough to get real compensation.

Attorneys like the set back in their offices on their computer and phones all day but rarely make it to the courtroom.

This is why they’re not charging fees when they Are not able to provide you with favorable results reason being is because they don’t have much invested they don’t have a lot of time invested they don’t have anything material wise invested other than maybe a sheet of paper in an envelope.

resp.text:
We have no record of ever representing a Thomas Vercetti. We believe this review to be fraudulent.

In any event, our goal is to provide the absolute highest level of legal representation. We are committed to our clients’ cases and are willing to do whatever is necessary to obtain justice.

Reviews like this one are not only inaccurate, but they do a disservice to our staff who work diligently in service to our clients.

resp.text: I take all reviews, both good and bad, seriously.  I have no record of "Amal White" as a client.  However, we strive to provide quality legal advice and excellent customer service. There are times when we choose to withdraw from cases for various reasons.  Legal opinions are not an exact science.  I sincerely hope you find the answers you are looking for. text: Best personal injury lawyer in the state. Hope you or a loved one is never hurt but if you have to sue an insurance company, this is your guy in Alabama. Tyler used to work as an insurance adjuster (i believe thats the official title) which means his paperwork is always the way the insurance company wants it when it is submitted. Therefore his claims will prob be put on top of the stack compared to other attorneys. It was in my case. Me personally, i was hurt in a car accident on I-65 and was worried i couldnt pay the medical bills. After having 2 sprained ankles and other various injuries(none too serious, thankfully) i ended up in a financial bind and needed the case settled quickly. He had my case settled and doubled the money i received in my hand in just 3 weeks compared to when i broke my back with another injury attorney that took over 2 years. Not only does he do a great job, he seems to genuinely be a good person and will help you all he can (his secretary, too!). Lastly, Tyler doesnt seem worried at all about taking your case to trial if he needs to. This attorney will not just try to settle your case and then pass you off to other attorneys if your case isnt an easy "cut and dry" claim which is VERY common in personal injury cases. I personally believe he will do a better job than ANY other injury lawyer for you because he did just that for me and he is still helping my father who was in the wreck with me but hurt worse.

name: Tara Davenport
text:
In December 2015 Jim Pino was referred to me by a family friend, also an attorney and who’s advice and opinion matter greatly to me.

I needed an attorney who would fight for me. To help and advise me with a divorce after 23 years of marriage. I knew going into it that it wasn’t going to be anywhere close to pretty, much less easy for a multitude of reasons. But I also knew that I had “hit my wall” and it was necessary. I also knew that I was going to have to have an attorney that would work with me, not just for me. I had been married since I was 21.... nothing about anything was easy and I was terrified about everything.

And that’s exactly what Jim did for me.

Jim and his amazing staff helped me through one of the hardest times of my life and helped me find myself again.

I would and do, recommend Jim Pino & Associates to any and everyone who asks.

Thank you Jim and thank you to your awesome staff!!

name: Gordon Madden
text: There is not enough space to share my experience with Jim and the entire staff. They have worked with me for over a decade (11) years. Almost daily, many nights, weekends even when they've been on vacation. Never once failing to jump up to the emergency, or simply to make sure my son was protected. Because of Jim and his family, staff and associates, I have been given the opportunity to have a wonderful relationship with my little boy. He's stood in my defense against 17 different lawyers, sometimes 5 against 1. His son has stood with me as well. We've had multiple trials, most recently he postponed major surgery and suffered through a 4 day trial. Agonizing in Pain against 4 very reputable lawyers. Not to mention, he did this for 1/5 of the money the other guys were being paid. He did it because he cares and felt that it was in my son's best interest and we'll being. Just today, our order was issued. Once again, his hard work and character and one of a kind skill prevailed. I still have sole custody and I am assured a meaningful relationship with the most important thing in my life. I can never repay Jim for his decade long dedication to making sure we're protected. If you need help, a brief visit with him will reveal the true character and heart he puts into making sure justice prevails. My name is Gordon Madden and I would be happy to share my story with you.

name: Mike McLarty
text:
After a lifetime of hard work in blue collar jobs I was suddenly laid off due to my heart going bad. I found myself unemployed and, sadly, unemployable at the age of 44 and with four children, one of which is severely disabled and will require lifetime care.

Ms. Thiry had helped a friend get her Disability Benefits and me, not knowing anything about how to find a lawyer for myself, contacted Ms. Thiry to discuss my case.

I was totally lost, despondent. I felt like my life was over. The shame of not being able to provide for my family was crippling. I began to look into how my family would be provided for if I passed. It was bad.

From the onset Renee was very compassionate and beyond helpful, as was her entire staff. Anytime I had a question it was answered quickly. She explained the process to me, was honest about the time it would take, and the difficulties of my case because of my age.

Looking back, I think it was her hope and encouragement that sustained me, because I had none of my own.

I was awarded Full Disability, and my back pay was set six entire months before I thought it would be. I don't know how that happened, but I am grateful to Ms. Thiry for making it so.

I have my life back now and, with whatever time I have left I can concentrate on making quality memories with my children. That would not be the case if not for Ms. Thiry's considerable attention to my claim and the dedication of her staff.

I consider her a family friend now and highly recommend her. Were it not for her keen legal mind, good heart, and professionalism I have no idea where I would be now, or if I even would be.

From the bottom of my (malfunctioning) heart, thank you Renee Thiry. You were my angel when me and my family needed one the most.

text: I don’t usually write reviews but I have to in this case. I needed an lawyer back in November 2010 after I was involved in a car accident on my job. I found THIRY & CADDELL, LLP on the internet on a Saturday night.  They actually reach out to me that Sunday morning. I had a face to face meeting with Mr. Richard Thiry the following Monday. Mr. Richard went above and beyond my expectations. He was very passionate about his clients and it shows in his work and spirit. The legal process was easy and stress free, I was very informed throughout the whole process by Mr. Richard and his team, and I felt at ease asking any questions I had. Richard Thiry was very diligent and got me a settlement quickly. Fast forwarding on June 14,2018 I was again involved in another car accident on the job after only been employed 2 days. I immediately reach out to THIRY & CADDELL, LLP. Mr. Richard no longer practice law because he had retired but his daughter Renee Thiry also is a lawyer there.  First, I'd like to say THANK YOU to Renee Thiry and the staff. They are very professional, personable and very helpful team.  Renee always keeps her word and came through for me when I needed her most. I hired Renee for my workers comp and personal injury suit.  Renee always made me feel that she had things under control and was on top of the case. My job terminate me after 7 months because of permeant injury due to the car accident. She help me get my unemployment to help me out until my case was settle. As a single mom with two kids it help out A LOT. My workers comp case has now been settled and i am so relieved and will be forever grateful. I know that she is also going to do a great job with my personal injury case as well. I honestly don't know what I would do without them. If you want the best then you definitely want to hire Renee Thiry.  I cannot thank her enough for all she is doing for me. I don't believe any lawyer could have done any better, that's why I truly believe they are the Best!!!!

name: Woody Myers
text: Ms Thiry and the staff helped me beyond measure. My injurys put me out of work, they cut the red tape. Got Work Comp to pay me, got me the advanced treatment I needed and kept the stress down. And they helped me when the TV lawyers wouldn't take my case. Top notch!

text: Professional, and reliable.  They don't mind you calling them anytime and they are all straightforward.   I would highly recommend any attorney with this firm.

name: Natalie Schibell, MPH
text: I would give no stars if I could as I have made three calls over the course of two weeks seeking representation without a response. The answering service used is either not recording messages or the attorneys are being selective. I realize my matter is a small one; however, a return phone call within a reasonable amount of time is the bare minimum expectation this firm could not meet. I have worked in a prominent law firm for nearly a decade and know the value of customer service with every client, both large matters and small. I unfortunately cannot use that law firm as I moved a great distance away. Parkman and White, please return your phone calls, whether you can take the case or not. No firm is too big or an attorney too important to make a courtesy return call or email, at a minimum. You can even have your staff perform the task for you. This way a potential client cannot waste additional time and effort and can call someone else who cares enough to provide the service.

name: Ryan Blanch
text: We’ve litigated and tried several major cases together.  What a team.  These guys are simply awesome.  Jim Parkman captivates juries and judges alike with his humor and courtroom presence. Will White’s no-nonsense cutting cross examinations destroy government witnesses.  No one I’d rather go to trial with.

name: jonny harvell
text: To describe the ability of these men in their element is nearly impossible. I could not imagine a better team of attorney's to handle any civil, state or federal case. The honesty and determination showed during my case was, in one word, "AMAZING!" The experience and expertise displayed inside and outside the courtroom was outstanding. These guys are professionals on every level. If you are reading this and have a loved one in need of an attorney or need one yourself, Parkman & White is where your research should end!

name: Victor Revill
text: These are outstanding attorneys at this firm!!!   I was wrongfully arrested and charged in Blount County.  Attorney Clayton Tartt represented me and he did an AMAZING JOB.  He was prepared, professional, persistent, caring, compassionate, and an outstanding litigator!!! I am a Criminal Defense lawyer that was charged with a crime. I went to Clayton.  If a Criminal Defense lawyer chooses a Criminal Defense lawyer, then he will only choose the best.  I chose Clayton because I knew he cared about his clients and I knew he would be willing to fight. He fought to get me acquitted and I am forever grateful!!!  Trust me, Clayton is an outstanding attorney!!!

name: Jenn Carroll
text: By far the best!  William White and Jim Parkman are amazing at what they do. Anyone that ever asks me about a lawyer, I would refer them to Parkman and White, LLC. Best decision I have ever made.

name: Mike R
text: Mr. Parkman charged me tens of thousands of dollars.  I am convinced that he deliberately undermined my case. I had to hire another attorney to defend my case. I found Mr. Parkman to be insufferable,  highly inflammatory, arrogant and strikingly incompetent.  I really like William White.  He deserves a medal of honor for tolerating Jim Parkman.

name: Krystal Dixon
text: We hired Parkman and White after my husband was accused of a crime that could have landed him in jail for many years. He had done nothing wrong and unfortunately in our world of technology a computer virus was almost our undoing. We were told that if we wanted the best we should hire Parkman and White. We met Jim Parkman face to face a couple of times and though I did not have the pleasure of meeting William White, I had numerous phone conversations with him. They worked diligently to clear my husband's name. It took almost two years but the night before we were to go to court Mr. White called to inform us that all charges had been dropped. They fought to prove his innocence and I am so thankful that we were sent their way. Mr. Parkman and Mr. White definitely lived up to their reputation of being the best. If you have a legal issue I would highly recommend you get in touch with their law firm.

name: S Cole
text: When the stakes are the highest, and your personal reputation, recieving professional, educated, tanacious and agressive defence are of paramount importance . Parkman and White are the ONLY law firm to TRUST and RELY on.  William White and his team assisted me in a time of great legal need with my reputation, financial security, and potential criminal charges against myself. William White was tenacious, exposed the truth and my case was dropped in a Grand Jury Investigation.

text: During a time when I sought justice and it was nowhere to be found, I found Parkman and White.  And trust me, they helped me find justice.   At the end of my trial, justice prevailed and I was found not guilty on two counts of charges which ended my career.  If you are looking for justice, if you are looking to make a wrong right, look no further than Parkman and White.

name: Taylor Hayes
text: Spent 4 hours with Larry, he gave me a game plan, fed me tons of false hope, told me I have a great case, got extremely excited, signed papers with me, and said he'd represent me. Told me to keep living my life and he had everything under control. Didn't respond to phone calls and emails for a month. Then sent me a letter saying they wouldn't represent me in any of my cases but recommended I file with the EEOC and seek further legal counsel elsewhere but gave me no recommendations. I feel like I was enthusiastically lied to and now I'm at square one. Makes no sense. Very unprofessional.

name: Ada Alabama
text: Run as fast as you can away from this law firm.   If you are using them fire them right away.  They do not understand what it  is like to live in constant pain from an injury.  They are not aggressive but are the biggest wimps when it comes to standing up for their clients.   Once you are away from them you will find out all of the things they did not bother to find out or perhaps purposely did not tell you.   Again, they will not stand up for you.   Find a better law firm.  They are useless when you need them the most.

name: Christopher Calvin Reid
text: Alex is the best Attorney in his field. He is a genius in the courtroom and he finds a way to win when other attorney's call it a day. He was an excellent Attorney back in law school and has only improved! #reidlawalabama fully and completely endorses him. Anyone who would give him less than 5 stars has no clue what they are talking about.
